author: keww
title: NFT Devs Bridge to Project Catalyst
description: There is a lack of connection between PC Community / Voters & NFT Project Creators / Developers

f6_assessments.q0: I like the effort to stay focused in just the one area of NFTs for this project, giving it a wide base but avoiding sprawl.  The proposer is a long time Catalyst member, having been funded previously, and able to roll leverage from that funding (in the form of equipment obtained) into this new project, which significantly keeps the costs down.  I am curious about the choice to make the 20 videos all livestream interviews....I suppose the liveness is a fellow traveler of the NFT phenomenon, very much in the mold of limited-window drops, but it feels limiting to the idea.  Maybe it the desire to have the Q&A ability of the interview with the live chats.  Regardless, that will amount to a lot of NFT projects, within Catalyst (and if the cohort isn't robust enough, from without) and probably eager for a little extra help on the marketing side.  The real synergy of the product comes from funded projects being able to offload some of their responsibilities with the outreach and marketing, which means this project will be able to be measured by how much it is helping others as well, including being able to direct projects outside of Catalyst to become proposers.  The ability to bring in multiple projects under the umbrella speaks to the challenge setting requirements of decentralizing the effort of getting more FAM content generated.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer lines out a the specific tools and software he will be using for the recording, and budgets the time to each video by the hours spent, which makes it very easy to assess the budget as an hourly rate, which is not something you see much of in this challenge.  Where it was a little fuzzy was the actual timeline for delivery.  Due to how they have the onboarding of funded proposers laid out, including proposers from previous funds who they want to be able to start with a retrospective, I expect that their timeline for this project is the 3 months that make up Fund 9, with the idea that it could then roll over into new funding for Fund10 if it proves popular, though this does entail a ramp in the production needs, with the proposer estimating 3 shows a weak at the peak rate.  I am reminded how important the "marketing" funding area was considered to be in the original IOG "Treasury" document, and I find it surprising how much potential reach small projects like this can have for really penny-ante funds comparatively.  The only real risk one might point to is that this is a solo project to deliver 20 productions, but the proposer notes that they have become a Full Time Catalyst Member, and so they expect to have plenty of time to deliver.
f6_assessments.q2: The listed deliverables are adequate, with a measure for general community growth around the livestreams, along with onboarding of projects, but I think they can add another metric, which would be to track how successful the projects he is interviewing are.  This would give an idea of the impact on the larger ecosystem, and measure more of the actual challenge impact contained in this proposal.  Beyond that, being sure to track the early work networking and collecting info from funded projects is the only other piece of advice I would offer.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge of communication between "PC Community / Voters & NFT Project Creators / Developers" is something Cardano is currently building beyond the scope of Youtube and unheard podcasts with the introduction of "Spaces" on Twitter (the main source of NFT promotion/information alongside Discord). This solution from the proposer is still more of a niche to the Cardano community, as many Developers/NFT creators and collectors, buyers/sellers are still unaware of Project Catalyst. Speaking with a number (10-15) of successful CNFT Project developers, they have little to no knowledge of what Project Catalyst is, what it's accomplishing in the *background* of the Cardano community. Projects presented for Fund 9 could greatly benefit from the proposal if the content could be guaranteed to reach a wider audience. As far as impact goes, it might even be better to interview PC members with Fund 9 Projects as well as established projects developers that have had success and are still building strong communities within the ecosystem for more efficiency to the cause; two birds one stone. This may pose a bigger challenge for the proposer, but consequently providing a much greater impact to Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the scope of the proposal it seems feasible to consider many content creators produce 1-2 videos per day and are able to live stream or record/edit that content within a 24-48hr periods. It is not unrealistic to believe all parties involved, the proposer, PC member and NFT Creators to be scheduled for an interview would be most difficult. Though it does seem like it could become overwhelming for one person, the proposer, to manage alone. As mentioned, taking advantage of an extensive network within the Cardano community to seek outside assistance would be in their best interest for i.e.: keeping content fresh and engaging Q&A's. Until Funding round 9 begins, a realistic timeline would be challenging for the proposer to truly commit to. It would be best if what is stated here, "During the weeks preceding Fund 9 I will make contacts with current fund 8 proposers and fund 7 cohorts with direct involvement in NFT space, as well as Project Catalyst, who may be involved with Fund 9 again. We will discuss this project and how it may have helped them, then build around that," could be well defined in a more than "this is the plan" type criteria. Having a solid course of action proposed would be better suited for achievable results.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer states they have an extensive network within the Cardano ecosystem which can be utilized. It would be beneficial to this proposal to include references of past accomplishments in relevant fields to Cardano blockchain and NFT creation in order to bring factual content in the future interviews. Seeing a list of previous interviews, perhaps links to the mentioned discord link so more members reading this proposal might join now and prepare for any videos that might be funded. Now with funded content under FTC guidelines required by law with any connection to Project Catalyst, would these videos technically be "Sponsored" videos? As each video, the proposer is asking $400usd (20 videos) totaling $8,000usd. The current content being produced under the Youtube channel lacks some production value which could be elevated from the funding, bringing more than the average 50-300 views of past videos/content to hopefully 10 times that, making a bigger impact and adding much more value to the Cardano community. How one might audit the progress of such content, could be established through the views and amount of listeners to each episode. This may be the only way to gauge the proposal's progress without weekly reports, and solely relying on community outreach to determine demand for more related content. As for viewing the website provided, it is important to note the Discord Invite Link is outdated and leads to no additional information that could verify current members interest or involvement moving forward.

f6_assessments.q0: Good initiative, the proposals which require a larger sum of money can be introduced via these podcasts benefiting the Cardano coomunity in assessing the proposal better. It would accomplish the spread of NFT and blockchain information to the new users by the NFT creators themselves also benefit the NFT devs in investing more time in generating the actual content.
f6_assessments.q1: YouTube stats: A total of 4 videos with views more than 1k. YouTube channel dedicated to Cardano , PC and Blockchain active since April 2021. 54 uploads, 372 subscribers. The quality of content in the videos which i  watched is great. If he could use a portion of fund to advertise the content on different social media platforms, the interviews would reach a wider audience. Also the fund requested could have been lesser judging by the fact that resources needed are less (400$ per half hour stream).
f6_assessments.q2: No specific number of views/engagements or community growth. "Increase number of interview candidates overtime" can be less-of an audit factor for the current funding, rather increased number of viewership, either from Cardano community or general public should have been the factors.

f6_assessments.q0:
While the proposal sounds intriguing, having 20 half hours streams with NFT creators/developers who are looking for funding in Fund 9 could benefit with some added features to make it fit better the challenge brief “We need a bridge between YouTube, the traditional media, TV and film.” This content is for now niche, even in the Cardano NFT space, not to mention the crypto space at large, which in itself is very small, but for which Cardano is, so far, only a small part.
As the briefing of the challenge continues “It's crucial to create educational and inspiring content which the national media and TV stations would gladly use in their daily programmes”, which as described above, the content of this string of streams does, unfortunately, not quite fit the description.
As much as I like the idea, I think it needs additional content to be suitable in this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer offers a comprehensive description of the project plan, from contacting fund 7 & 8 proposers with direct involvement in the NFT space, to ask for their input about his proposal, and how it might have helped them, to describing how he will help the teams he will be interviewing attract viewers. 
The budget is very simple but complete, since the proposal in itself doesn’t require any personnel or equipment outside of the proposer and what he has acquired from previous Catalyst funds.
Although the proposer will be doing everything by himself and has already been funded in Project Catalyst and is also well known in the Cardano NFT space, for the voters who are not involved with CNFTs or are new to Project Catalyst, some description about his skills and previous work would be just as important.
f6_assessments.q2:
The progress of the project is focused on a couple of steps, but for assessing the advancement of the streams and for independent verification of any community member, these are sufficient.
The success description is concise but also sufficient, having 20 live interviews completed and requests from the community to keep them ongoing is indeed a good measure of success.

f6_assessments.q0: This would help 20 teams bring some good NFT continued exposure to Cardano, while, of course, helping them with their projects. I like the community assistance aspect of the project. His hourly rate of $40-$50 is very modest.
f6_assessments.q1: In the comments, it seems from @allisonfromm it gives Ken a good testimony, in addition to his website and proposal content. His website is worth a visit for further confidence in funding this project: active examples, links to artwork on IPFS, and applicable examples that show expertise: is worth a visit.
f6_assessments.q2: I do not think much more info is needed here, for this seems like a good amount of value for the amount of funding requested. If asking for more of an amount: I may have wanted to see more of a roadmap, timelines, more specifics in the auditability section. This was why I deducted a star (but was reluctant to...seems like an good project!).

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer points out the problem within the challenge, elaborates and presents a solution. Video recording on Cardano and the Catalyst eco system is a solid tool for spreading knowledge and adding value about Cardan. The key metrics and goals meet the requirements of the challenge. Upon completion of this project, the project is still able to address future challenges. Proposer explains the possible risks and offers appropriate solutions.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal clearly provides a link through which we can get all the necessary information about the project and the expertise of the project contractor. It is clear that in last 12 months, there have been videos on the youtube channel created by Keww - Ken Adams. The budget is clearly defined and presented. What is missing is a time frame of the project elaborated in a little more detail. Ken states that during Catalyst F9 he will start further work on creating Cardano videos and connect with current fund 8 proposers and fund 7 cohorts with direct involvement in NFT space.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is lacking a developed roadmap which would give us a more detailed insight into when certain interviews / videos will be done. It is stated in the proposal that the 20 videos will be filmed and they can serve the community well to follow this project. With all the effort and work so far that is visible on the links that go with the proposal, I come across a problem and that is the small number of viewers. The Youtube channel is not so visited and has small number of subscribers which opens up an additional idea for the proposition on how to attract more viewers to the channel and video content in the future.

solution: I will host twenty, half hour live streams with NFT creators / developers who are seeking funding through Project Catalyst in Fund 9
experience: Project Catayst F5 & 6 Cohort, YouTube & Odysee Channel Owner, Multiple edited interviews and Live Streams with various contributors, NFT Creator & Investor, Discord Administrator
